001package io.github.ai4ci.functions;
002
003import java.io.Serializable;
004import java.util.Arrays;
005import java.util.stream.IntStream;
006
007import org.immutables.value.Value;
008import org.mariuszgromada.math.mxparser.Argument;
009import org.mariuszgromada.math.mxparser.Expression;
010import org.mariuszgromada.math.mxparser.mXparser;
011
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnore;
013import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonDeserialize;
014import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.annotation.JsonSerialize;
015
016import io.github.ai4ci.functions.Coordinates.DuplicateResolution;
017
018/**
019 * A mathematical function that can be evaluated at runtime. This is used to
020 * represent functions that are defined by the user as part of the configuration
021 * of the model, such as the viral load to transmission probability mapping.
022 *
023 * <p>
024 * The function is defined by a String expression containing `x` as the
025 * parameter, which is parsed and evaluated using the mXparser library. The
026 * parsed expression is derived from the original String and is not serialized,
027 * ensuring that only the user-defined expression is stored in the
028 * configuration.
029 *
030 * @see io.github.ai4ci.abm.OutbreakBaseline#transmissibilityFromViralLoad(double,
031 *      double)
032 */
033@Value.Immutable
034@JsonSerialize(as = ImmutableMathematicalFunction.class)
035@JsonDeserialize(as = ImmutableMathematicalFunction.class)
036public interface MathematicalFunction extends Serializable, SimpleFunction {
037
038        /**
039         * Compute the differential of the empirical function at a given X value.
040         * <p>
041         * This method computes the differential of the empirical function at a given
042         * X by applying the chain rule to the interpolated value and its derivative.
043         * It uses the derivative of the link function and the derivative of the
044         * interpolator to compute the overall differential at the specified X.
045         *
046         * @param x the X value at which to compute the differential of the empirical
047         *          function
048         * @return the differential of the empirical function at the specified X
049         */
050        @Override
051        default double differential(double x) {
052                return this.getLink()
053                        .derivInvFn(
054                                this.getInterpolator()
055                                        .interpolate(x)
056                        ) * this.getInterpolator()
057                                .differential(x);
058
059        }
060
061        /**
062         * A univariate mathematical function as a String containing `x` as the
063         * parameter and returning a value of y on the link scale. Supported
064         * expressions are described here:
065         * https://mathparser.org/mxparser-math-collection
066         *
067         * @return the function expression on the link scale.
068         */
069        String getFXExpression();
070
071        /**
072         * The interpolation method used to interpolate between the (x,y)
073         * coordinates.
074         *
075         * @return the interpolation method used to interpolate between the (x,y)
076         *         coordinates
077         */
078        @Value.Default
079        default Interpolators getInterpolationType() {
080                return Interpolators.CUBIC_SPLINE;
081        }
082
083        /**
084         * The interpolator created from the coordinates and interpolation type.
085         * <p>
086         * This method constructs an interpolator based on the (x,y) coordinates and
087         * the specified interpolation type. It applies the link function to the Y
088         * coordinates before interpolation. The resulting interpolator can be used
089         * to compute interpolated values for any X within the range of the
090         * coordinates.
091         *
092         * @return the interpolator created from the coordinates and interpolation
093         *         type
094         */
095        @JsonIgnore @Value.Derived
096        default Interpolator getInterpolator() {
097
098                Coordinates tmp = ImmutableCoordinates.builder()
099                        .setX(this.getX())
100                        .setY(this.getY())
101                        .setXMin(this.getMinimum())
102                        .setXMax(this.getMaximum())
103                        .setXLink(LinkFunction.NONE)
104                        .setYLink(this.getLink())
105                        .setIncreasing(false)
106                        .setResolveDuplicates(DuplicateResolution.MEAN)
107                        .build();
108
109                return this.getInterpolationType()
110                        .create(tmp.getHx(), tmp.getHy());
111
112        }
113
114        /**
115         * A link function used to transform the Y coordinates after evaluation.
116         *
117         * @return the link function used to transform the Y coordinates
118         */
119        @Value.Default
120        default LinkFunction getLink() { return LinkFunction.NONE; }
121
122        /**
123         * The maximum support of the expression
124         *
125         * @return the maximum support of the expression
126         */
127        double getMaximum();
128
129        /**
130         * The minimum support value of the expression
131         *
132         * @return the minimum support for the expression
133         */
134        double getMinimum();
135
136        /**
137         * The (x,y) coordinates defining the knot points.
138         *
139         * @return the X coordinates defining the knot points
140         */
141        @Value.Derived
142        default double[] getX() {
143                return IntStream.rangeClosed(0, 100)
144                        .mapToDouble(
145                                i -> getMinimum() + i / 100.0 * (getMaximum() - getMinimum())
146                        )
147                        .toArray();
148        };
149
150        /**
151         * The (x,y) coordinates defining the knot points.
152         *
153         * @return the Y coordinates defining the knot points (true scale)
154         */
155        @Value.Derived
156        default double[] getY() {
157                var xArg = new Argument("x");
158                mXparser.disableUlpRounding();
159                mXparser.disableCanonicalRounding();
160                mXparser.disableAlmostIntRounding();
161                var exp = new Expression(this.getFXExpression(), xArg);
162                return Arrays.stream(getX())
163                        .map(x -> {
164                                exp.setArgumentValue("x", x);
165                                return exp.calculate();
166                        })
167                        // FX is on the link scale. We need to calculate the true scale for
168                        // setting coordinates object (in getInterpolator())
169                        // This is a bit inefficient but only happens once.
170                        .map(y -> getLink().invFn(y))
171                        .toArray();
172        }
173
174        /**
175         * Evaluate the interpolated mathematical expression at a given X value.
176         * <p>
177         * This method computes the value of the expression at a given X by
178         * interpolating the Y values at the coordinates and then applying the
179         * inverse link function to the interpolated value. The result is the value
180         * of the mathematical function at the specified X.
181         *
182         * @param x the X value at which to evaluate the expression
183         * @return the approximate value of the expression at the specified X
184         *
185         */
186        @Override
187        default double value(double x) {
188                return this.getLink()
189                        .invFn(
190                                this.getInterpolator()
191                                        .interpolate(Interpolator.squish(getMinimum(), x, getMaximum()))
192                        );
193        }
194
195}
